Text: Apparently, the foreign policy of the Biden Admin is: Better late than never. After failing to apply sanctions and forcing Democrats to vote against them, Biden is finally doing the right thing. Putin’s #NordStream2 pipeline should have been sanctioned a long time ago. https://t.co/dmCgqAJZwi

The day after Russia invaded Ukraine, @POTUS has released a critical minerals list that makes the U.S. more vulnerable to Russia & our adversaries. We have abundant supplies of uranium & helium. @POTUS should make producing them in America a top priority. https://t.co/qZ7Ec7bwSm
President Biden must respond with crippling sanctions on Russia immediately. The world is watching – especially China. If Putin gets away with this, it will embolden China to move against Taiwan.

There isn’t time for weakness or indecision. Putin is illegally trying to take over parts of Eastern Ukraine and ordering Russian troops to roll in. Putin is a predator who wants to put together the old Soviet Union. If he’s not stopped, it won’t end with Ukraine.

America can help loosen Putin’s economic and political grip on the region. Biden must lift the burdensome restrictions on producing and exporting abundant American energy. We should pass my ESCAPE Act that will expedite American natural gas exports to our allies.

Germany finally took a step in the right direction on the #NordStream2 pipeline. Putin must not believe this is a momentary pause but an end to the pipeline. It is past time for the U.S. and Europe to quickly impose sanctions on Putin’s pipeline.

I had the honor of serving for more than ten years in the Senate with Johnny. It was a privilege to know him and to count him as a friend. Bobbi and I send our condolences to his wife Dianne and their entire family.

We were all inspired by Johnny’s courage while he fought Parkinson’s disease. When he left office in 2019, his service continued through the Isakson Initiative. His foundation is transforming medical research and continuing Johnny’s mission or getting more cures to patients.

Georgia and the entire country lost one of its most beloved public servants today. For decades, Johnny Isakson fought for the people of Georgia in the House and Senate. Johnny led by example. He brought people together to solve the tough challenges facing our country.
